explanation: get_m_algo uses only the three identifiers force_md5/force_sha256/force_sha512_256 and returns values of type MHD_DigestAuthMultiAlgo3 (the listed enum constants). To prove it does not (even indirectly) use any <string.h> functions or cause out‑of‑bounds accesses you must examine: 1) the definitions/declarations of force_md5, force_sha256 and force_sha512_256 to confirm they are plain booleans/variables (not macros or inline functions that expand to or call string.h functions such as strcmp/strlen or perform pointer arithmetic). 2) the typedef/definition of MHD_DigestAuthMultiAlgo3 and the listed enum constants to ensure they are simple enum values (not macros or expressions that could invoke functions or cause memory accesses). In short, inspect the source/header locations that define these symbols (and any macros used to implement them) to rule out hidden uses of string.h or out‑of‑bounds memory accesses.
